Add a new node to network

Source: R/add_node.R
add_node.Rd

Add a node to the network. Takes the node id (string), the node type (string), and the node level (int).

add_node(sbm, id, type = NULL, show_messages = TRUE)

Arguments

sbm

sbm_network object as created by new_sbm_network.
id

Unique identifying name for node.
type

Type of node (string). This is used to distinguish multipartite networks. E.g. "person", or "publication", etc..
show_messages

Should function inform of its actions such as when a model already exists so no changes are made?

Value

An S3 object of class sbm_network. For details see new_sbm_network section "Class structure."

See also

Other advanced: add_edge(), get_node_to_block_edge_counts(), initialize_blocks(), set_node_parent(), update_state()

Examples


# Start with network with 5 nodes.
net <- sim_random_network(n_nodes = 5, prob_of_edge = 1, setup_model = TRUE)

# Verify nodes
net$nodes
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>   id     block type 
#>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>
#> 1 node_1 node  node 
#> 2 node_2 node  node 
#> 3 node_3 node  node 
#> 4 node_4 node  node 
#> 5 node_5 node  node 
net %>% get_state()
#>       id parent type level
#> 1 node_1   none node     0
#> 2 node_2   none node     0
#> 3 node_3   none node     0
#> 4 node_4   none node     0
#> 5 node_5   none node     0

# Add two nodes
net <- net %>%
  add_node('new_node1', type = 'node') %>%
  add_node('new_node2', type = 'node')

# New nodes are added to node data and state
net$nodes
#> # A tibble: 7 x 3
#>   id        block type 
#>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>
#> 1 node_1    node  node 
#> 2 node_2    node  node 
#> 3 node_3    node  node 
#> 4 node_4    node  node 
#> 5 node_5    node  node 
#> 6 new_node1 NA    node 
#> 7 new_node2 NA    node 
net %>% get_state()
#>          id parent type level
#> 1 new_node1   none node     0
#> 2 new_node2   none node     0
#> 3    node_1   none node     0
#> 4    node_2   none node     0
#> 5    node_3   none node     0
#> 6    node_4   none node     0
#> 7    node_5   none node     0
